body:
@ravwojdyla could you please restart the Travis build ? we generally don't expect it to be all green, but this is all red.
I don't think there's an issue here but I'd still like to see some non-Python tests pass.
This now has another prerequisite change for #2053. Should be all of it now.
@tgroh I'm now happy with the state of this. This sits on top of #2072, #2055 and #2035 but it's probably also fine to review it all here in one go.

Sure, if the majority is against, let's revert.
I wanted the PR up for review to see if we want to use it, as I believe it is a good middle ground that most could live with.

I'm not convinced that the travis failures are providing any actual signal other than "travis and our build don't get along" - there's a Javadoc timeout, there's the eclipse compile acting up, and there are a couple of generic travis timeouts
It seems to be ok to merge.

I would claim that there isn't really a "default translation" for `CreatePCollectionView`, but there may be some common ones, and it may be worth refactoring the common style of "Concatenate-and-write-view" overrides into `runners-core-construction`  (either here or elsewhere; I'd prefer the latter).

Most of this is also going to go away once more of the runner API is implemented, more precisely `ViewFns` as the way we specify a view. That may be ultimately implemented very similarly, and may have an approximately identical solution, but hopefully we'll have fewer `CreateView` transforms and just one way to materialize a collection.

+R: @aaltay

I noticed that this PR now includes a bunch of files not related to this PR (there are now 317 files associated with this change.) We can't review this change while that's the case since there's so many other files (and I believe that's what's causing the conflicts error above.) It looks like you did a 'git merge' instead of doing a git 'rebase'. Please fix this PR up so it does not include any changes except what you've done.

Thanks!

Also - I'm thinking it may be easier to break this PR up into chunks and do them each as their own PR.

Some useful chunks could be: 
1) Just check in the core files (HadoopInputFormatIO and HadoopInputFormatIOTest, plus any necessary files for that) 
2) add in cassandra unit tests + ITs
3) add in ES unit tests + ITs
4) add in performance tests

I'm fine with however you want to chunk this up, but I think chunking this change up would make code reviewing much simpler, and speed up the process of getting the changes in.
Run Dataflow RunnableOnService
